comments:
This is using Eclipse 3.1M3 in JDK 1.5.0 on Red Hat 9.

I decided I wanted to move a class between projects. So I right-click on the
class in the Navigator, choose "Refactor->Move", browse to the desired package
in the new project ... but when I press either "OK" or "Preview" in the
resulting dialogue box, it fails.

The dialogue box says "Unexpected error when performing the refactoring. See log
for a detailed error description. See error log for more details." (which is
redundant in itself, but not the subject of this bug report. :) )

If I un-check "Update references to the moved element(s)" though in the dialogue
box, then the refactoring actually succeeds.

In the error log, as far as I can tell this is the backtrace. Sorry it's a bit
long. :)

The problem is caused by a CDT. They install a DocumentSetupParticipant which
throws a NPE. 

Moving to CDT. 

Which version of CDT to you use ?

As far as I can recall, I've got the most recent version of CDT from the update
site at http://update.eclipse.org/tools/cdt/releases/new .

However, I'm confused about the numbering. The plugin identifies itself as
"2.1.0" in some places, and "2.0.0" in others; "about features from Eclipse"
gives the build ID as 200411090921; however, the most recent thing on the update
site is named "2.0.2".

Hopefully that's enough information to figure out what version I'm actually running?
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 81555 ***
